unnormalised: **Brand Collabs Gone Wild! Is Your Feed Ready?**
normalised: **Brand Collaborations Gone Wild! Is Your Feed Ready?**

unnormalised: Social media's buzzing about the latest brand collaborations, and honestly, some are kinda wild! From fashion brands teaming up with your local chaiwala to fintech apps partnering with biryani restaurants (who knew you could pay for your Hyderabadi biryani with crypto?), the possibilities seem endless.
normalised: Social media is buzzing about the latest brand collaborations, and honestly, some are kind of wild! From fashion brands teaming up with your local chaiwala to fintech apps partnering with biryani restaurants (who knew you could pay for your Hyderabadi biryani with crypto?), the possibilities seem endless.

unnormalised: This Onam season saw some interesting linkups – imagine, Kathakali dancers promoting online grocery delivery! While some collabs feel natural, others leave you scratching your head like 'Why, oh why?'
normalised: This Onam season saw some interesting linkups – imagine, Kathakali dancers promoting online grocery delivery! While some collaborations feel natural, others leave you scratching your head like 'Why, oh why?'

unnormalised: Influencer marketing is clearly evolving, and brands are trying hard to grab eyeballs. Remember that IIT Bombay professor turned gaming streamer who partnered with a coaching center? Unexpected, right?
normalised: Influencer marketing is clearly evolving, and brands are trying hard to grab eyeballs. Remember that I I T Bombay professor turned gaming streamer who partnered with a coaching center? Unexpected, right?

unnormalised: Analysts predict the Indian influencer marketing industry will hit Rs. 2200 crore by 2025, fueled by these quirky partnerships. Are they effective? Debatable. But they definitely keep things interesting! Let's see what Diwali brings... maybe a collab between a firecracker brand and a meditation app? Stay tuned, folks! Your feed's about to get even more crowded.
normalised: Analysts predict the Indian influencer marketing industry will hit rupee two thousand two hundred crore by two thousand and twenty five, fueled by these quirky partnerships. Are they effective? Debatable. But they definitely keep things interesting! Let's see what Diwali brings... maybe a collaboration between a firecracker brand and a meditation app? Stay tuned, folks! Your feed is about to get even more crowded.
